concept.title: Financial benefits
concept.shortdesc: Examples of calculations of financial benefits when using multiple deduction method for companies employing 647 and 1500 workers

conbody.p: In order to avoid payments to PFRON by employing persons with disabilities, the employment rate of such persons should be at least 6%.

p.b: COMPANY 1 - hiring 647 FTEs - real life example

conbody.p: Company profile: A manufacturing/logistics company. Physical work is domitating, in such companies it is the most difficult to eliminate penalties for PFRON.

Baseline:
647 FTEs in general
4 employees with disabilities

ul.li: The employment rate of persons with disabilities in this company is 0.6%(4/647)

The company has to pay obligatory contribution for not employing 34.8 FTEswith disabilities based on the following calculations
647*0,06=38,8
38,8 – 4

The sum of the contributions to be paid is 84 807,74 PLN (18309,39 EUR/19815,35 USD) monthly based on
34,8*0,4065*5 995,09 PLN= 84 807,74 PLN

p.b: What is an optimal way to fill 34,8 full-time positions with persons with disabilities and forget about contributions paid to PFRON?

conbody.p: The fastest solution is to employ remote workers (from any part of Poland) who are entitled to a triple or fourfold PFRON allowance.

p.b: The solution adopted by the employer for reducing of PFRON payments:

ul.li: employment of one person with a single deduction from PFRON. This person is a "handyman" for physical work. It was not possible to find a person with a disability with multiple deductions for this position

employment for the other vacancies persons with triple or fourfold deductions from PFRON for the fully remote office jobs. Most of them were able to come to the company's premises for a few days of training; however this was not a requirement of the employer. Some persons with disabilities with severe conditions (in wheelchairs) were trained online.

conbody.p: One person with a fourfold deduction (9,744 PLN/ 2,096 EUR/2,096 USD) received a gross salary of 8000 PLN (1,721 EUR/1,856 USD). The employer's costs (to cover her salary) are 9600 PLN (2,065 EUR/2,227 USD). Another person has an excellent knowledge of Excel and B2 level English. She is entitled to a triple deduction (7308 PLN/1,572 EUR/1,695 USD). She will earn 5000 PLN gross (1,075 EUR/1,160 USD). The employer's costs are about 6000 PLN (1,290 EUR/1,392 USD).
Company profile:office work is dominating - banking, insurance etc. Headquarter of the X company.

Baseline:
1500 FTEs in general
9 employees with disabilities

ul.li: The employment rate of persons with disabilities in this company is 0.6%(9/1500)

The company has to pay obligatory contribution for not employing 81 FTEswith disabilities based on the following calculations
1500*0,06=90
90 – 9

The sum of the contributions to be paid is 197,316 PLN (42,564 EUR/46,060 USD) monthly based on
81*0,4065*5 995,09 PLN= 197,316 PLN which annually is 2,367,792 PLN(510,682 EUR/552,728 USD)

p.b: The solution that can be adopted by the employer for the fastest reduction of PFRON payments:

ul.li: employment of 20 people with the fourfold deduction (20*4=80) and one at 0.25 FTE (4*0.25 = 1).

conbody.p: Let us assume that the employer hires these 21 persons on 81 full-time positions paying on average for the whole position 3900 PLN gross (employer's costs 4680 PLN).
In case of employing one person from the amount of four times allowance (9744 PLN) 48% is spent on salaries of persons with disabilities. 52% of the amount is left on the company account.
Annually it gives no less than 1.231.252 PLN (265,555 EUR/286,991 USD)
